data.name: CryptographySettingsDefaultHashProviderNameDescription
data.value: 1009 - The name of the Hash Provider to use when code does specify the name of a configured Hash Provider.

data.name: CryptographySettingsDefaultSymmetricCryptoProviderNameDescription
data.value: 1011 - The name of the Symmetric Cryptography Provider to use when code does specify the name of a configured Symmetric Cryptography Provider.

data.name: CryptographySettingsDescription
data.value: 1007 - Configuration settings for the Cryptography Application Block.

data.name: CryptographySettingsHashProvidersDescription
data.value: 1013 - The list of configured Hash Providers for the Cryptography Application Block.

data.name: CryptographySettingsSymmetricCryptoProvidersDescription
data.value: 1015 - The list of configured Symmetric Cryptography Providers for the Cryptography Application Block.

data.name: CustomHashProviderDataDescription
data.value: 1017 - A Hash Provider implementated as a custom class, and added to Enterprise Library.

data.name: CustomHashProviderDataNameDescription
data.value: 1019 - The name of the Custom Hash Provider.

data.name: CustomHashProviderDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: 1021 - The fully qualified type name of the Custom Hash Provider.

data.name: CustomSymmetricCryptoProviderDataAddCommand
data.value: Custom Symmetric Crypto Provider (using type picker)

data.name: CustomSymmetricCryptoProviderDataAlgorithmTypeNameDescription
data.value: 1025 - The fully qualified type name of of a class that derives from SymmetricAlgorithm and implements the cryptography algorithm for this provider.

data.name: CustomSymmetricCryptoProviderDataDescription
data.value: 1023 - A Symmetric Cryptography Provider implementated as a custom class, and added to Enterprise Library.

data.name: CustomSymmetricCryptoProviderDataNameDescription
data.value: 1027 - The name of the Custom Symmetric Crypto Provider.

data.name: CustomSymmetricCryptoProviderDataProtectedKeyFilenameDescription
data.value: 1029 - The absolute path and the file name of the file that contains the encrypted key. This value is not required for DPAPI symmetric providers.

data.name: CustomSymmetricCryptoProviderDataProtectedKeyProtectionScopeDescription
data.value: 1031 - Specifies whether the machine store or the user store is used for storing secrets. Possible values are CurrentUser and LocalMachine. This value is not required for DPAPI symmetric providers.

data.name: CustomSymmetricCryptoProviderDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: 1033 - The fully qualified type name of the Custom Symmetric Crypto Provider.

data.name: DpapiSymmetricCryptoProviderDataDescription
data.value: 1035 - A Symmetric Cryptography Provider that uses Data Protection API to encrypt and decrypt secrets.

data.name: DpapiSymmetricCryptoProviderDataNameDescription
data.value: 1037 - The name of the DPAPI Symmetric Crypto Provider.

data.name: DpapiSymmetricCryptoProviderDataScopeDescription
data.value: 1039 - The scope for which the the key is valid. CurrentUser means that the provider will use the current user's profile to generate the key, and only that user can decrypt secrets. LocalMachine means that any code running on the machine has access to the protected key, and can decrypt any secret encrypted in LocalMachine mode.

data.name: DpapiSymmetricCryptoProviderDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: 1041 - The fully qualified type name of the DPAPI Symmetric Crypto Provider

data.name: HashAlgorithmProviderDataAlgorithmTypeNameDescription
data.value: 1045 - The fully qualified type name of of a class that derives fromHashAlgorithm and implements the hashing algorithm for this provider.

data.name: HashAlgorithmProviderDataDescription
data.value: 1043 - A hash algorithm provider that uses .NET hash algorithms that do not require a generated key.

data.name: HashAlgorithmProviderDataNameDescription
data.value: 1047 - The name of the Hash Algorithm Provider.

data.name: HashAlgorithmProviderDataSaltEnabledDescription
data.value: 1049 - Determines if a random string (a salt value) is generated and pre-pended to the plaintext before hashing. Using salt helps to guard against dictionary attacks, which take longer because every entry in the dictionary must be hashed with every possible salt value.

data.name: HashAlgorithmProviderDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: 1051 - The fully qualified type name of the Hash Algorithm Provider.

data.name: HashProviderDataDescription
data.value: 1053 - A base class for all hash providers.

data.name: HashProviderDataNameDescription
data.value: 1055 - The name of the Hash Provider.

data.name: HashProviderDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: 1057 - The fully qualified type name of the Hash Provider.

data.name: KeyedHashAlgorithmProviderDataAlgorithmTypeNameDescription
data.value: 1061 - The fully qualified type name of of a class that derives from HashAlgorithm and implements the hashing algorithm for this provider.

data.name: KeyedHashAlgorithmProviderDataDescription
data.value: 1059 - A hash algorithm provider that uses .NET hash algorithms that require a generated key.

data.name: KeyedHashAlgorithmProviderDataNameDescription
data.value: 1063 - The name of the Keyed Hash Algorithm Provider.

data.name: KeyedHashAlgorithmProviderDataProtectedKeyFilenameDescription
data.value: 1065 - The absolute path and the file name of the file that contains the encrypted key. This value is required for keyed hash algorithms.

data.name: KeyedHashAlgorithmProviderDataProtectedKeyProtectionScopeDescription
data.value: 1067 - Specifies whether the machine store or the user store is used for storing secrets. Possible values are CurrentUser and LocalMachine. This value is required for keyed hash algorithms.

data.name: KeyedHashAlgorithmProviderDataSaltEnabledDescription
data.value: 1069 - Determines if a random string (a salt value) is generated and pre-pended to the plaintext before hashing. Using salt helps to guard against dictionary attacks, which take longer because every entry in the dictionary must be hashed with every possible salt value.

data.name: KeyedHashAlgorithmProviderDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: 1071 - The fully qualified type name of the Keyed Hash Algorithm Provider.

data.name: SymmetricAlgorithmProviderDataAlgorithmTypeNameDescription
data.value: 1075 - The fully qualified type name of of a class that derives from SymmetricAlgorithm and implements the cryptography algorithm for this provider.

data.name: SymmetricAlgorithmProviderDataDescription
data.value: 1073 - A symmetric cryptography algorithm provider that uses .NET symmetric algorithms.

data.name: SymmetricAlgorithmProviderDataNameDescription
data.value: 1077 - The name of the Symmetric Algorithm Provider.

data.name: SymmetricAlgorithmProviderDataProtectedKeyFilenameDescription
data.value: 1079 - The absolute path and the file name of the file that contains the encrypted key. This value is not required for DPAPI symmetric providers.

data.name: SymmetricAlgorithmProviderDataProtectedKeyProtectionScopeDescription
data.value: 1081 - Specifies whether the machine store or the user store is used for storing secrets. Possible values are CurrentUser and LocalMachine. This value is not required for DPAPI symmetric providers.

data.name: SymmetricAlgorithmProviderDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: 1083 - The fully qualified type name of the Symmetric Algorithm Provider.

data.name: SymmetricProviderDataDescription
data.value: 1085 - A base class for all symmetric cryptography providers.

data.name: SymmetricProviderDataNameDescription
data.value: 1087 - The name of the Symmetric Provider.

data.name: SymmetricProviderDataTypeNameDescription
data.value: 1089 - The fully qualified type name of the Symmetric Provider.
